alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 07 at 2:56PM CST until January 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Rapid Spread of Wildfire Is Possible Monday Evening and again Tuesday Afternoon... .A strong cold front will bring a surge of very dry air and strong northwesterly winds Monday evening, beginning across the Brush Country and Rio Grande Plains shortly after sunset and spreading across much of the rest of the Rio Grande Valley and Deep South Texas by mid to late evening. Relative humidity will crash into the teens and lower 20s during the evening before rising back into the 20s overnight as temperatures fall. Winds will diminish a bit on Tuesday, but still remain strong enough to combine with continued dry air to return relative humidity below 20 percent by early afternoon. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE COMBINATION OF STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW HUMIDITY, AND RAPIDLY DRYING FUELS FOR MOST OF THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong northwest winds combined with very low humidity, which is in effect from Monday evening through Tuesday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Starr, Hidalgo, and Cameron and Willacy except the barrier islands. * TIMING...Monday Night through Tuesday Afternoon * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph Monday Night, and 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent Monday evening and again Tuesday afternoon. * TEMPERATURES...Falling from the 60s into the 50s Monday evening. Rising to the upper 60s Tuesday afternoon. * LIGHTNING...None. * IMPACTS...Rapid spread of wildfire on drying grasses and brush is likely Monday evening and again Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Plan to refrain from any burning between sunset Monday and sunset Tuesday. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
